page.title: 14Entertainment in Chilsworthy
page.content: The Chilsworthy/Latchley Show was first started towards the end of the second world war and carried on in the first instance until 1963. There was then a break until the{queen's jubilee {year of 1977, when it was restarted. Since that date the show has grown into one of the biggest local shows. The{main exhibits}are those entries into the various competitions for{<a> {vegetables <b> flower- arranging, <c> {handicraft <d> cookery.}There are also additional events, such as work from local schools, a tug o' war competion and other assorted stands from both trade and local organizations such as scouts and W.I. The{number of entries has risen to just under a{thousand}in the present year.
